reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew that easyhotel was going to be small but nothing prepares you for how small it is. If you have more than couple of overnight bags, then, it's best to forget it. But then, to be fair, they do have a bag storage place for which they charge you GBP 2.50 per bag.
reviews.title: It was unbelievably small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were travelling with two suitcases, which meant there was no place in the room to stand even. And while the toilet operates fine, use of the shower means that you wet everything else
reviews.title: Good if.....

likes.disliked: — Unhelpful Staff at check-in, no control over room temperature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we did managed to have a good night's sleep since the bed was quite comfortable. But not having a coffee vending machine meant that every morning, we'd have to trek to Sainsbury's nearby to get our fix from the local Starbuck's
reviews.title: Won't be using Easy Hotels again!!

reviews.text: If all you want in a hotel is a place to get your head down and shower, then you won't be disappointed with easyhotel. As other reviews state, it is cramped, but this particular hotel is in an excellent location, close to Gloucester Rd and Kensington high st tube stations. We stayed for two nights, but we were barely there at all. I'm afraid I don't agree with the previous review about hotel staff being helpful, When we checked in I had the feeling that we were an interuption to the staff member that checked us in, and they were not very helpful or informative. Calling this place the Ritz is deceptive and defeats the object of writing reviews, whilst it is clean and cosy, there is no hiding from the fact that this particular hotel has obvious pros and cons, the main ones being that whilst it is cheap, you don't get an awful lot for your money. If it's a bed and shower you are after- book it! If you want space and extras, spend more and go elsewhere!
reviews.title: Value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I stayed here for 1 night only - and are we glad it was for one night only?!!
reviews.title: SO small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 12 days in the smallest room with no window. While the room was small it had everything we needed and because we stayed so long they gave us 2 complimentary room cleans. The bed and bathroom were spotless and the rooms were very soundproof.
reviews.title: The nicest staff in London. :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was in a great location, 2 minutes walk to the subway, 1 minute walk to the supermarket and 3 minutes walk to some restaurants. Very safe at all times of the day and night.
reviews.title: Super budget hotel!! Nothing to complain about.

reviews.text: Staff were super friendly and really helpful, made our stay so much more enjoyable, with a hello and goodbye every time we walked in and out the door and lots of local info with anything from second hand bookshops to local pubs.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money!!

reviews.text: Would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone! :-)
reviews.title: £24.50 for a central London hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading through some reviews, I was quite unsure of the choice of Easy Hotel.
reviews.title: If you're willing to pay the price, it's worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes - you get what you pay for, but it's fine. We stayed 5 nights and actually grew to enjoy what we eventually called "the nest".
reviews.title: Good value for London
Easyhotel in London
reviews.text: ROOM: Literally as small as you've been warned. But we found the sheets clean, the bathroom clean and the amount of space we needed to at least place our bags on the floor was sufficient (about 2.5 feet by 10 feet running along the end of the bed and the bathroom door). If you can spring for a room with a window, you might want to - it may make it feel a little less small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: This easyHotel location was great. Safe area near a grocery store and a 5 minute walk to the tube. It appears there's an "easyHotel Earl's Court" location nearby that has better reviews, so you might want to check that out as well.
reviews.title: Small, uncomfortable and noisy...

reviews.text: PROPERTY: The building is in a long row of white townhouses. Nothing fancy, very basic. We were on the basement level in the back of the building. Completely quiet area, not on a main road.
reviews.title: Best budget hotel I've had in London. Clean and friendly!

reviews.text: PLUSES: We felt we got value for our money. All we wanted was a place to sleep and shower - that's what we got. The staff were friendly. The location is central. The bed was surprisingly comfy.
reviews.title: Be ready for the smallest room you ever have to stay in (hopefully). Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A room in central Lonon, 5 minutes from the tube stop for £35 punds a night for TWO people, amazing!!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Yes the room is miniscule, but they give you the EXACT measurements when you are booking if you go expecting something huge you will be disappointed. There is a comfortable bed, a showerroom and a tv, what else can you possibly need? Lets not forget that you are in London and the time you spend in the hotel should be totally minimal.
reviews.title: Small Room.....small price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place, would totally stay again. Those who complain the room was too small knew what they were getting before arrival so I find this a really unfair criticism.
reviews.title: Ridiculously small room

reviews.text: Stayed at the Easy Hotel in London (Kensington) for one night. I shared a room with my neice so we paid roughly £20 each for the night. It is VERY small, no floor space apart from a tiny square to stand in where the door opens so if you want to spend ages getting dressed up and ready to go out, then probably not for you (unless you potter around on the landing outside the room). The room we shared had no windows so felt a little closed in........but for the price it had clean linen, a good hot shower and was generally clean and not noisy and it felt secure. All in all in was fine for one night!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We (late 20s couple) obviously weren't expecting much from EasyHotel because of the price and budget reputation but the room was just unbeliveably small. Would have been too small for one person. Total floor space not including bed and equally tiny bathroom was perhaps less than 2 square metres. A prison cell would have been more comfortable, and I am not exaggerating.
reviews.title: Did they tell you the rooms are small?
